chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer
Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
The defendant Naihla L. Buckley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Naihla L. Buckley is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Naihla L. Buckley was found guilty of Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.203(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- Sign up for Probation on 09/07/22, Defendant to be taken to treatment program immediately after signing up for Probation, no stops along the way

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: 21CF900 Count 1 and 21CF858 Count 1, without prejudice to consecutive sentencing in the event of Probation revocation.

8:19 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Naihla L. Buckley in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson in court for Naihla L. Buckley.  Attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for State of Wisconsin.  Includes 21CF694, 21CF795, 21CF858, 21CF900, 21CM458, 22CF67, 22CF224, 22CF248.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NC to Ct 1- Possession of Methamphetamine in 21CF858, NC to Ct 1- Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer in 21CF900, & NC to Ct 1- Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer in 22CF67.  DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in files 21CF858, 21CF900, & 22CF67. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 2 in 21CF858, Ct 2-5 in 21CF900, Ct 2-5 in 22CF67, 21CF694, 21CF795, 21CM458, 22CF224 & 22CF248 with prejudice.  Bond money on file is on cases 21CM458, 22CF67, & 22CF224. Sentencing arguments. Court reserves on credit, attorneys to update the Court by 9/7/22.

S/W 3 Years  Probation is concurrent on all counts without prejudice to consecutive sentencing in the event of Probation revocation.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Appointing Atty Harrelson. km
Preliminary hearing on February 14, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing and ETG testing at least ONE time per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must report to the Justice Support Center immediately. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Sharron Hart.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.
